io.atomix.copycat.server

Interface RaftServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Managed<RaftServer>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CopycatServer

    public interface RaftServer
extends Managed<RaftServer>
    Provides an interface for managing the lifecycle and state of a Raft server.

    The lifecycle of the Raft server is managed via the Managed API methods. To start a server, call Managed.open() on the server. Once the server has connected to the cluster and found a leader, the returned CompletableFuture will be completed and the server will be operating.

    Throughout the lifetime of a server, the server transitions between a variety of states. Call state() to get the current state of the server at any given point in time.

    The term() and leader() are critical aspects of the Raft consensus algorithm. Initially, when the server is started, the term() will be initialized to 0 and leader() will be null. By the time the server is fully started, both term and leader will be provided. As the cluster progresses, term() will progress monotonically, and for each term, only a single leader() will ever be elected.

    Raft servers are members of a cluster of servers identified by their Address. Each server must be able to locate other members of the cluster. Throughout the lifetime of a cluster, the membership may change. The members() method provides a current view of the cluster from the perspective of a single server. Note that the members list may not be consistent on all nodes at any given time.

    Author:

    • Method Detail

      • term

        long term()
        Returns the current Raft term.

        The term is a monotonically increasing number that essentially acts as a logical time for the cluster. For any given term, Raft guarantees that only one leader() can be elected, but note that a leader may also not yet exist for the term.

        Returns:
        The current Raft term.

      • leader

        Address leader()
        Returns the current Raft leader.

        If no leader has been elected, the leader address will be null.

        Returns:
        The current Raft leader or null if this server does not know of any leader.

      • members

        Collection<Address> members()
        Returns a collection of current cluster members.

        The current members list includes members in all states, including non-voting states. Additionally, because the membership set can change over time, the set of members on one server may not exactly reflect the set of members on another server at any given point in time.

        Returns:
        A collection of current Raft cluster members.

      • state

        RaftServer.State state()
        Returns the Raft server state.

        The initial state of a Raft server is RaftServer.State.INACTIVE. Once the server is started and until it is explicitly shutdown, the server will be in one of the active states - RaftServer.State.PASSIVE, RaftServer.State.FOLLOWER, RaftServer.State.CANDIDATE, or RaftServer.State.LEADER.

        Returns:
        The Raft server state.

      • context

        ThreadContext context()
        Returns the server execution context.

        The thread context is the event loop that this server uses to communicate other Raft servers. Implementations must guarantee that all asynchronous CompletableFuture callbacks are executed on a single thread via the returned ThreadContext.

        The ThreadContext can also be used to access the Raft server's internal serializer via ThreadContext.serializer(). Catalyst serializers are not thread safe, so to use the context serializer, users should clone it: 

           
   Serializer serializer = server.threadContext().serializer().clone();
   Buffer buffer = serializer.writeObject(myObject).flip();
        Returns:
        The server thread context.

      • open

        CompletableFuture<RaftServer> open()
        Starts the Raft server asynchronously.

        When the server is started, the server will attempt to search for an existing cluster by contacting all of the members in the provided members list. If no existing cluster is found, the server will immediately transition to the RaftServer.State.FOLLOWER state and continue normal Raft protocol operations. If a cluster is found, the server will attempt to join the cluster. Once the server has joined or started a cluster and a leader has been found, the returned CompletableFuture will be completed.

        Specified by:
        open in interface Managed<RaftServer>
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the server has joined the cluster and a leader has been found.

      • isOpen

        boolean isOpen()
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether the server is running.

        Once open() is called and the returned CompletableFuture is completed (meaning this server found a cluster leader), this method will return true until closed.

        Specified by:
        isOpen in interface Managed<RaftServer>
        Returns:
        Indicates whether the server is running.
